results.title: Marvin's room
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and Jerry Zaks
results.brief_description: Bessie is a strong, sensitive and selfless middle-aged woman who has sacrificed her life to look after her ailing and bed-ridden father and slightly daft aunt. Her younger sister, Lee, shirked off such responsibilities, left home, married and had two children before divorcing. The marked differences between the two have meant that neither sister has been in contact for 20 years. But now Bessie has been diagnosed with leukemia, and her survival may depend on the sister she has long since erased from her life, or her two nephews whom she has never met. Cast includes: Diane Keaton, Meryl Streep, Robert De Niro, and Leonardo Di Caprio.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Miramax Films, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and Jerry Zaks

results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tim Burton and Larry Franco
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).

results.title: Married to the mob
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Mysterious Arts, Kenneth Utt, Edward Saxon and Jonathan Demme
results.brief_description: This comedy from director Jonathan Demme (Philadelphia, Beloved, Something wild, The Silence of the lambs) is a spoof on the mobster/gangster genre. Angela DeMarco is unhappily married to Frank, a low-level mafia operator, and is tired of the mob-life with all the trappings. When Frank dies in mysterious circumstances, Angela decides to start a new life, as far from the mob as she can manage. Unbeknownst to Angela, an FBI agent is trailing her in order to get the dirt on Tony. Complications ensue when the agent following Angela, falls for her instead. Demme keeps the tone light throughout with caricatures of New York mob types, in particular the women with over the top hair and a gaudy aesthetic. Modine does well playing to the stereotype of the uncool, bumbling FBI agent. Cast includes: Michelle Pfeiffer, Dean Stockwell, Matthew Modine, Nancy Travis, Mercedes Ruehl, Joan Cusack, Oliver Platt, Chris Isaak and Alec Baldwin. Music by David Byrne of Talking Heads.

results.title: Marriage Italian style = Matrimonio all'Italiano
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Carlo Ponti and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: In flashback, Don Domenico recalls his wartime romance with Filumena. He is so enamoured with her that he finances her escape from the bordello where she lives and works, and sets her up as manager of his business. Later, he finds a place for her as his mother’s domestic help. Whilst he continues to provide for her, he is not interested in making their union legal, expecting her to act as servant by day and mistress by night. Years later, Filumena lies on her deathbed, and Don Domenico finally consents to marry her, only to find she makes a full recovery immediately after the vows have been taken. He tries to weasel his way out of this fraudulent arrangement, but is mollified by Filumena’s insistence that one of her three sons is his. Cast includes Sofia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni. It Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Marnie [DVD]
results.brief_description: Marnie is a psychodrama with a background of crime and suspense. Tippi Hedren is Marnie, a kleptomaniac and compulsive liar who goes to work as a secretary for Mark Rutland (Sean Connery), and then attempts to rob him. Upon discovering this, Rutland impulsively marries the troubled beauty and attempts to uncover the reasons for her obsessive behaviour and sexual frigidity. When a terrible accident pushes his wife to the edge, Rutland forces Marnie to confront her terrors and her past in a shattering conclusion. Includes music score by Bernard Herrmann. Cast includes Tippi Hedron, Sean Connery, Diane Baker, Martin Gabel, Louise Latham.

results.title: Marlene
results.brief_description: Maximilian Schell has created a fascinating film, amusing and sad, imaginative and courageously put together. He presents Dietrich as a genuine star to a new generation of moviegoers. Included are scenes from “Destry Rides Again”, “Morocco”, “Witness for the Prosecution”, “Judgement at Nuremberg”. Dietrich is difficult, forgetful, egotistical, with a unique presence and an unexpectedly forthright manner.

results.title: Marked woman
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Louis F. Edelman, Hal B Wallis, Jack L. Warner and Lloyd Bacon
results.brief_description: A hard boiled B-girl (Bette Davis), is determined to turn the tables on Mobster Johnny Vanning (Eduardo Ciannelli), who has recently taken over the management of the nightclub where she works and is attempting to turn out the current employees. It proves to be hard task for one individual so she enlists the help of a district attorney (Bogart), and her fellow workers at the nightclub (Rosalind Marquis, Lola Lane, Isabel Jewell and Mayo Methot). This film is based on the trial of New York Gangster Lucky Luciano, sent to prison on the basis of evidence from prostitutes.

results.title: Mark Twain's Tom Sawyer : A Musical Adaptation
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, APJAC Productions, Reader's Digest, Arthur P. Jacobs and Don Taylor
results.brief_description: This is the first film version of Mark Twain’s classic novel to be set to music. Starring Johnny Whitaker, Celeste Holm, Warren Oates and a young Jodie Foster the film is a joyous escape for all ages.

results.title: March of the wooden soldiers = Babes in Toyland
results.creator_credit: Federal Films, Hal Roach, Charles Rogers and Gus Meins
results.brief_description: Laurel and Hardy are well-meaning toymakers who muddle an order for Santa. Instead on making one 600 foot high soldier, they make one hundred six-foot soldiers instead. The toy army comes in handy when Barnaby and his furry Bogeymen invade Toyland. The boys end up as heroes as they save Widow Peep’s daughter Bo. Originally known as “Babes in Toyland”, the film was heavily censored as it was considered too scary for children, and it was seldom seen after the Disney remake of 1963. Nevertheless, it remained one of Laurel and Hardy’s best films and it was the personal favourite of Hardy.
